programme.title: Opus
programme.desc: A journalist is invited to the remote compound of a legendary pop star who mysteriously disappeared 30 years ago. Surrounded by the star's cult of sycophants, she gets caught in the middle of his twisted plan.

programme.title: The Peanut Butter Falcon
programme.desc: After running away from a residential nursing home to pursue his dream of becoming a pro wrestler, a man who has Down syndrome befriends an outlaw who becomes his coach and ally.

programme.title: Billy Joel: And So It Goes
programme.desc: After the success of "Piano Man," Billy Joel's career takes off with a string international hits and record-breaking tours.

programme.title: Billy Joel: And So It Goes
programme.desc: Through countless setbacks, Joel reinvents himself with a return to his roots and a residency at Madison Square Garden.

programme.title: Katrina Babies
programme.desc: An intimate look at the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina and its impact on the youth of New Orleans.

programme.title: The Nun II
programme.desc: An evil spreads in 1956 France as a priest is murdered and Sister Irene once again comes face-to-face with the demonic nun Valak.

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop a cyborg killing machine, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

programme.title: Maggie
programme.desc: When a deadly zombie virus sweeps the nation, a father stops at nothing to save his infected daughter.

programme.title: Green Lantern
programme.desc: The Green Lanterns have little regard for humans, who have been unable to harness the powers of the ring each member wears. But Jordan, a test pilot, may be the corps' only hope when an enemy called Parallax threatens the universal balance of power.

programme.title: Surviving Ohio State
programme.desc: Based on the Jon Wertheim's 2020 Sports Illustrated article, Why Aren't More People Talking About the Ohio State Sex Abuse Scandal?

programme.title: Enigma
programme.desc: An exploration of transgender identity and legacy through the stories of icons April Ashley and Amanda Lear.

programme.title: Sing Sing
programme.desc: A man is imprisoned at Sing Sing for a crime he didn't commit. When joined by a wary outsider, he finds purpose in staging an original comedy with a theater group of other incarcerated men.

programme.title: Why Him?
programme.desc: An overprotective businessman (Bryan Cranston) panics after learning that his daughter's (Zoey Deutch) wealthy but socially awkward boyfriend (James Franco) plans to ask for her hand in marriage.

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: A thief (Leonardo DiCaprio) who enters people's dreams and steals their secrets gets a shot at redemption when he is given the dangerous task of planting an idea in someone's subconscious.

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Godzilla and the almighty Kong face a colossal threat hidden deep within the planet, challenging their very existence and the survival of the human race.

programme.title: The Hunger Games
programme.desc: A resourceful teen takes her younger sister's place in a brutal contest in which youths from each of 12 districts fight to the death on live television.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
programme.desc: After their unprecedented victory in the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark embark on a Victors Tour. Katniss senses rebellion is stirring, but a cruel change in the upcoming 75th Hunger Games may change Panem forever.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 1
programme.desc: After shattering the games forever, Katniss (Jennifer Lawrence) finds herself in District 13, fighting to save Peeta (Josh Hutcherson) and a nation moved by her courage.

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay, Part 2
programme.desc: Katniss faces mortal traps, deadly enemies and moral choices when she and her closest friends leave District 13 to assassinate President Snow and liberate the citizens of war-torn Panem.

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: Four couples find that paradise comes at a price when they must participate in therapy sessions at a tropical resort.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: A poor boy (Freddie Highmore) and four spoiled children win a tour through the incredible factory of an odd confectioner (Johnny Depp).

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: A sudden attack by Wulf, a ruthless Dunlending lord, forces Helm Hammerhand and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg. Finding herself in a desperate situation, Helm's daughter must lead the resistance.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Here to Climb
programme.desc: Sasha DiGiulian rises from child prodigy to a champion sport climber, as she ultimately makes her mark by taking her talents to big walls with a series of first female ascents.

programme.title: My Scientology Movie
programme.desc: Filmmaker Louis Theroux is denied admittance into the Church of Scientology's headquarters, setting into motion a clever, confrontational and funny plan to try and reveal the inner workings of the mysterious organization.

programme.title: Red Dawn
programme.desc: After foreign troops seize control of an American town, a group of young people takes refuge in the surrounding woods and launches guerrilla attacks against the enemy.

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A scientist's quest to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease unintentionally results in a highly intelligent chimpanzee, which may signal the end of man's dominion over Earth.

programme.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga
programme.desc: Young Furiosa gets caught in the crossfire of two tyrannical warlords. As the tyrants fight for dominance, Furiosa soon finds herself in a nonstop battle to make her way home.

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Bowling buddies become involved with a multimillionaire and his family wanted by mobsters in 1990s Los Angeles.

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Bowling buddies become involved with a multimillionaire and his family wanted by mobsters in 1990s Los Angeles.

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Convinced that Superman (Henry Cavill) is now a threat to humanity, Batman (Ben Affleck) embarks on a personal vendetta to end his reign on Earth, while the conniving Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg) launches his own crusade against the Man of Steel.

programme.title: The Alto Knights
programme.desc: In the 1950s, New York crime bosses Frank Costello and Vito Genovese vie for control of the streets. Once the best of friends, petty jealousies and a series of betrayals place them on a deadly collision course that reshapes organized crime forever.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: In Time
programme.desc: Accused of murder, a man (Justin Timberlake) must figure out how to bring down a system where time is money, enabling the wealthy to live forever, while the poor must beg for each minute of life.

programme.title: A Different Man
programme.desc: Aspiring actor Edward undergoes a radical medical procedure to drastically transform his appearance. But his new dream face turns into a nightmare as he becomes obsessed with reclaiming what he lost.

programme.title: Land of the Lost
programme.desc: A time-space vortex sucks a scientific has-been (Will Ferrell) and his companions (Anna Friel, Danny R. McBride) into an alternate dimension populated by dinosaurs and painfully slow creatures called Sleestaks.

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: A young man (Miles Teller) and his girlfriend (Anna Kendrick) struggle to find desirable employment after graduating from college.

programme.title: Brandy Hellville & the Cult of Fast Fashion
programme.desc: The Instagram-perfect image of Brandy Melville hides a toxic work culture endemic to fast fashion, with discrimination against race, sex and body size.

programme.title: The Brink
programme.desc: Filmmaker Alison Klayman follows political strategist Stephen K. Bannon as he tries to mobilize and unify far-right parties during the 2018 U.S. midterm elections.

programme.title: Green Lantern
programme.desc: The Green Lanterns have little regard for humans, who have been unable to harness the powers of the ring each member wears. But Jordan, a test pilot, may be the corps' only hope when an enemy called Parallax threatens the universal balance of power.

programme.title: Companion
programme.desc: A weekend getaway at a remote cabin turns to chaos when it's revealed that one of the guests -- a subservient android built for human companionship -- has gone haywire.

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: Three girls are kidnapped by a man with a diagnosed 23 distinct personalities. They must try to escape before the apparent emergence of a frightful new 24th.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: A descendant of the mysterious secret society known as the Assassins uses his newfound knowledge and physical skills to battle the power-hungry Templar Order.

programme.title: The Captain

programme.title: The Captain
programme.desc: Jeter wins his 5th and final World Series and celebrates his 3000th hit, but it's not all smooth sailing for this aging superstar. He goes through a very public and difficult contract negotiation that changes his relationship with the Yankees.
